text:
I'm thinking it must be something to do with this:

listMarketBook/listRunnerBook
*PriceProjectionWeight*Null (No PriceProjection set)2SP_AVAILABLE3SP_TRADED7EX_BEST_OFFERS5EX_ALL_OFFERS17EX_TRADED17
*Please note*: specific combinations of priceProjections will carry different weights that aren't the sum of their individual weights. Please see a summary of these below:
*PriceProjectionWeight*EX_BEST_OFFERS + EX_TRADED20EX_ALL_OFFERS + EX_TRADED
32

listMarketBook/listRunnerBook
: specific combinations of priceProjections will carry different weights that aren't the sum of their individual weights. Please see a summary of these below:

text: (that didn't paste well)
from the docs
But, I'm presumably looking at a fraction of the data you guys normally do

elements.text: But, I'm presumably looking at a fraction of the data you guys normally do

text: So that is confusing me
You’ve gone over the limit.
SP_AVAILABLE is 3 points and SP_TRADED is 7

elements.text: SP_AVAILABLE is 3 points and SP_TRADED is 7

text: Plus 32 is 42.
You’d have to go down to four markets, or request less per market.

elements.text: You’d have to go down to four markets, or request less per market.

text:
So simple, ha! Tbh I hadn't even considered it was something so obvious as I was looking at so few markets!

I've been searching to see if I was running multiple scripts somehow, ha!

Out of curiosity then, does no-one run multiple markets simultaneously? Seems surprising (or does everyone ignore the full depth / traded history)?

elements.text:
So simple, ha! Tbh I hadn't even considered it was something so obvious as I was looking at so few markets!

I've been searching to see if I was running multiple scripts somehow, ha!

Out of curiosity then, does no-one run multiple markets simultaneously? Seems surprising (or does everyone ignore the full depth / traded history)?

text: I think people just use the stream.

elements.text: I think people just use the stream.

text: Use streaming
It has lower latency than polling, is easier, and doesn’t have the same system around weighting of requests.

elements.text: It has lower latency than polling, is easier, and doesn’t have the same system around weighting of requests.

text: You could make the same requests for up to 200 markets with streaming and that would be fine.

elements.text: You could make the same requests for up to 200 markets with streaming and that would be fine.

text:
Ah I see, okay, so my first call is to get the current position on load, then I switch to streaming for everything subsequent.

Need to re-write that it would appear.

Thank you, much appreciated, will give that a go.

text: out of curiosity though, is there a better way to get a starting position than calling listMarketBook on startup (or is that the only/best way, but just simply don't call the full history/depth etc and pick up the rest later from streaming)?

elements.text: out of curiosity though, is there a better way to get a starting position than calling listMarketBook on startup (or is that the only/best way, but just simply don't call the full history/depth etc and pick up the rest later from streaming)?

text: If you want position use listCurrentOrders

elements.text: If you want position use listCurrentOrders

text: Not listMarketBook
